title: 109_hr4844
content: The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires voters to provide photo identification. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates individuals to present a government-issued photo ID when voting in person for a Federal office. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires individuals to show a valid photo ID proving US citizenship to vote in Federal elections. If ID is not provided, a provisional ballot may be cast, but eligibility to vote will not be determined without the required ID. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates individuals voting other than in person to submit a government-issued, current, and valid photo identification with their ballot to the election official within 48 hours. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires individuals voting absentee to provide a government-issued identification as proof of United States citizenship, with an exception for overseas military voters. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates that individuals voting absentee must show government-issued identification proving U.S. citizenship. Amendments include changing the heading to focus on providing photo identification and updating subsection references. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires individuals voting absentee to show government-issued identification proving U.S. citizenship. Amendments focus on providing photo identification for the general election starting in November 2008 and subsequent Federal elections. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates states to offer photo identifications for individuals lacking government-issued IDs to vote in elections, starting in fiscal year 2008. The Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006 requires states to provide photo identifications to individuals without government-issued IDs for voting purposes. The fee charged must be reasonable, and individuals unable to afford the fee can provide an attestation to waive it. The photo identification provided cannot be used for any other government program or function. States will receive payments to cover the costs of implementing this program. The Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006 mandates states to provide photo identifications to indigent individuals for voting purposes. The Commission will make payments to cover the costs incurred by states in providing these identifications. The amount of payment will be based on the fees that would have been collected by the state under the program. Authorization of appropriations is also included in the Act. The Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006 mandates states to provide photo identifications to indigent individuals for voting purposes. Payments will be made to cover the costs incurred by states in providing these identifications, with authorization of appropriations for fiscal years specified.
